intro: Tanacetum gracilicaule, commonly known as slenderleaf tansy, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring finely divided, fern-like leaves and yellow button-like flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in meadows and grasslands. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in herbal medicine, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
